alert.note: Alert for Riverside (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 28 at 3:25PM PDT until September 28 at 9:30PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Riverside County in southern California... * Until 930 PM PDT Wednesday. * At 325 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Chiriaco Summit, Eagle Mtn and Cottonwood Visitor. This includes the following highways... CA Interstate 10 near mile marker 100...and between mile markers 82 and 90. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
